hi people
can someone help me? im pretty new in ubuntu, trying to get the gstreamer mp3 plugin, but i cant find it in the synaptic
you need to enable the universe repository
you can read about this on the restrictedformats page, i believe
it's called gstreamer0.8-mad, i think
then it is likely that you have made an error. read the instructions carefully and try again; if it still doesn't work, post your /etc/apt/sources.list to the paste-bin
fair enough. you can also put screenshots on the paste-bin, if you prefer
ok, can you open 'gedit' (applications -> accessories -> text editor)
ok, go to file -> open
double-click 'Filesystem' (on the left)
then in the list window on the right, double click 'etc', then 'apt' and then 'sources.list'
you should see a file starting with 'deb cdrom <more stuff>'
ok, leave that window open. point your browser to http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl
copy and paste the text of the file (sources.list) into the large text-entry area on the web-page, and press 'send' (you can put you nick in the space, if you want)
ok, the only repository you appear to have enabled is the sourceforge.net wine repository
anything with a '#' at the front is ignored in that file
cool, np
